definition: to tumble/to fall/fig. to suffer a reverse (in politics or business)
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: Babies tumble when they are learning to walk.
sentences.chinese: 幼兒在學走路時常常跌倒。

sentences.english: I was embarrassed for her when she slipped and fell.
sentences.chinese: 當她滑了一跤跌倒時，我替她感到困窘。

sentences.english: Kneeling is not fall, but may be trampled.
sentences.chinese: 跪着雖不會跌倒，但可能被踐踏。

sentences.english: Practice English even when you fall down. ;
sentences.chinese: 甚至在跌倒時也練英語。

sentences.english: Feel free to leave your shoelaces untied, you will not fall over.
sentences.chinese: 讓你的鞋帶自由的散開，你也不會因此而跌倒。

sentences.english: She nearly fell down by stumbling over my stretched leg.
sentences.chinese: 她絆在我伸出的腿上，險些跌倒。

sentences.english: The man ran toward the emperor before falling unconscious to the ground, where he lay groaning.
sentences.chinese: 他徑直向皇帝跑來，但終於不省人事跌倒了。

sentences.english: Our blood-sugar was falling so low that we frequently stumbled as we fought through the sucking mud.
sentences.chinese: 我們的血糖降得很低以致於我們不斷在泥濘中跌倒。

sentences.english: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away.
sentences.chinese: 若是右手叫你跌倒，就砍下來丟掉。

sentences.english: However, the phenomenon of his son's falling down occurred more frequently and even severely.
sentences.chinese: 但是，陳立光跌倒摔跤的印象越來越嚴重。

sentences.english: He that falls today maybe up tomorrow again.
sentences.chinese: 今日跌倒的他或許他日還能東山再起。

sentences.english: One may sooner fall than rise.
But he fell when he tried the back flip.
sentences.chinese: 可是他試著要後空翻的時候卻跌倒了。

sentences.english: If any man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.
sentences.chinese: 人在白日走路，就不至跌倒，因爲看見這世上的光。

sentences.english: All this I have told you so that you will not go astray.
sentences.chinese: 我已將這些事告訴你們，使你們不至於跌倒。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, there are a lot of people who still fall for such despicable mottos .
sentences.chinese: 不幸地，仍然有很多人們跌倒在這樣可鄙的座右銘前。

definition: to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to fall down/to take a fall
to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to fall/to drop
to slip (lose one's footing)
to trip/to stumble
to injure oneself in a fall
to collapse/to topple over
to stagger along
a tumble/a fall
to trip and fall/to wrestle/wrestling (sports)
to drop down/to fall
to fall into/to dip below a certain level
to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
to fall flat on one's face (vulgar)
